meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time to dive into the review-iverse and see what all the fuss is about with The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame. I've got my favorite snacks, a comfy chair, and a healthy dose of skepticism – let's get this party started!

First off, it seems like some critics are not impressed (who would have thought?). COGconnected gives it a whopping 20 out of 100, calling it a "frustrating cash grab" that's an insult to the very spirit of LEGO. Eurogamer Italy echoes similar sentiments, saying the game looks like a reskin of LEGO Worlds without the charm and humor of the movie.

On the other end of the spectrum, we've got 3DJuegos, who actually enjoys the sandbox gameplay mechanics, comparing them to LEGO Worlds (now that's some nostalgia right there). Meristation gives it a decent score, saying it's an easy game for kids, but a bit of a letdown for adults.

Now, I'm no expert (okay, maybe a little), but I've got my own opinions and experiences to share. As someone who loves LEGO (who doesn't?!), I went in with moderate expectations – after all, this is a movie tie-in we're talking about. And you know what? It's not the worst thing ever!

The gameplay is a mixed bag. On one hand, exploring the various levels and collecting LEGO bricks is always fun. On the other hand, some areas feel like they were just phoned in – static environments, anyone? The co-op mode can be a bit wonky at times, too.

But here's the thing: The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame isn't trying to reinvent the wheel or impress critics with its depth and complexity. It's a kids' game, through and through! And if you're looking for a fun, lighthearted experience that won't break the bank (or your sanity), this might just be the ticket.

So, what's my verdict? Well, I'm not going to give it a score or anything fancy like that. Instead, I'll just say that The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame is a solid, if unremarkable, addition to the LEGO franchise. If you're a fan of the movies or just looking for some family-friendly fun, this might be worth your time.

That's it for now, folks! Hippo Penny out – see you in the next review!
